Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SP-E (natural AMPs, Pro-rich, PrAMPs, pigs, mammals; animals; UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: porcine salivary gland granules,Sus scrofa domesticus

Literature Information.Literature:
Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (60.71%) toSP-BP: 68%; K: 14%, R: 0%, G: 11%. A Pro-rich peptide without arginine. GRAVY: -1.74; M Wt: 2733.242; Mol formula: C132H202N32O31, mol ex. coeff: 0.Activity: active against A. baumannii (MIC 1.053-1.981 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 3.315-8.511 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 2.386-3.304 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 2.662 uM), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (1.447 uM), 
C. neoformans 6995 (EC50 2.215 uM), A. fumigatus UP1 (EC50 58.68 uM), and C. albicans SC5314 or UP10 (EC50 2.581-34.7 uM), but not S. aureus (EC50 > 100 uM).Toxicity: not hemolytic till 250 uM (0.026% vs. 2.6% 0.5% Triton-X100). SP-E did not show particular toxicity
at 50 uM (MTT assay) to murine 3T3 fibroblast cell line, HL60 monocytes and the oral squamous carcinoma cell line PECA/PJ15.Animal model:wax moth: the peptide (6 umol/kg) protected G. mellonella larvae (50% dead after 6 days, vs. control 87.5% dead) infected with P. aeruginosa 9027 strain (3 x 10 to the power 3 cells/mL).MOA:bacteria: it acts on intracellular targets (Ciociola et al., 2018).
Literature Information.Author: Conti S, Radicioni G, Ciociola T, Longhi R, Polonelli L, Gatti R, Cabras T, Messana I, Castagnola M, Vitali A.  2013
Literature Information.Title: Structural and functional studies on a proline-rich peptide isolated from swine saliva endowed with antifungal activity towards Cryptococcus neoformans.
